title: "Notes Soft"? non aligning numerals
content:
Hello Typos.  
I'm trying to I.D this face for a client.  
Apprently it is "Notes Soft" but can't  
find any record of it.  
Any ideas.

Also and perhaps most importantly  
I need to find a version or something similar  
with Aligning numerals  
Any idea?!

thanks lovleys

Mr Brown

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101201002315im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Public-Gallery0001_3749.png)
author: Mr Brown

comments.content:
Hi Simon,  
you can have [PTL Notes Soft Tf (= Tabular figures)](http://web.archive.org/web/20101201002315/http:/www.primetype.com/faces_info.php?fid=34).  
F

Don't worry, it exists, and with lining numerals, too (in addition to the oldstyle numerals you have in your sample) :)

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/primetype/notes-soft/](http://web.archive.org/web/20101201002315/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/primetype/notes-soft/)

It only matches your top (I think, can't really tell) and middle samples, though. The bottom one is something else.

<cite>The bottom one is something else.</cite>  
Yeah, Notes Soft with a customised ‘I’.

The small cap 'I' is actually without serifs, but I think Florian is right that they chopped them off the capital 'I'. Here's the entire [PTL Notes Soft family](http://web.archive.org/web/20101201002315/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/primetype/ptl_notes_soft_bundle_ot/?sample_text=PUBLIC%20public%20123&sample_size=36) with all the variations.
